1.title: Mark 1
1.description: Mark 1:1-8 John Prepares the Way for Jesus, Mark 1:9-11 Jesus Is Baptized by John, Mark 1:12-13 Jesus Goes Away to be Tempted by Satan, Mark 1:14-15 Jesus Begins His Work in Galilee, Mark 1:16-20 Jesus Chooses Some Followers, Mark 1:21-28 Jesus Frees a Man From an Evil Spirit, Mark 1:29-34 Jesus Heals Many People, Mark 1:35-39 Jesus Goes to Other Towns, Mark 1:40-45 Jesus Heals a Skin Diseased Person

2.title: Mark 2
2.description: Mark 2:1-12 Jesus Heals a Paralysed Man, Mark 2:13-17 Levi Follows Jesus, Mark 2:14-22 A Question About Fasting, Mark 2:23-28 Jesus Is Lord Over the Sabbath Day

3.title: Mark 3
3.description: Mark 3:1-6 Jesus Heals a Man on the Sabbath Day, Mark 3:7-12 Many Follow Jesus, Mark 3:13-19 Jesus Chooses His Twelve Apostles, Mark 3:20-30 Who Gave the Power to Jesus?, Mark 3:31-35 Jesus' Mother, Brothers and Sisters Come to See Jesus

4.title: Mark 4
4.description: Mark 4:1-20 Jesus Tells and Explains a Story of Farmer Sowing Seeds in the Field, Mark 4:21-25 Light of the Lamp, Mark 4:26-29 Jesus Tells a Story About a Seed, Mark 4:30-34 Jesus Tells a Story About a Mustard Seed, Mark 4:35-41 Jesus Stops a Storm

5.title: Mark 5
5.description: Mark 5:1-20 Jesus Frees a Man From Evil Spirits, Mark 5:21-43 Jesus Gives Life to a Dead Girl and Heals a Sick Woman

6.title: Mark 6
6.description: Mark 6:1-6 Jesus Goes to the Town He Lived, Mark 6:7-13 Jesus Sends His Apostles to Places in Twos, Mark 6:14-16 Herod Thinks Jesus is John the Baptizer, Mark 6:17-29 How John the Baptizer got Killed, Mark 6:30-44 Jesus Feeds more than 5000 People , Mark 6:45-52 Jesus Walks on Water , Mark 6:53-56 Jesus Heals Many Sick People

7.title: Mark 7
7.description: Mark 7:1-23 God's Law and People Laws are Different, Mark 7:24-30 Jesus Helps a Non-Jewish Woman, Mark 7:31-37 Jesus Heals a Deaf Man

8.title: Mark 8
8.description: Mark 8:1-10 Jesus Feeds More than 4000 People , Mark 8:11-13 Pharisees Ask Jesus to Perform a Miracle , Mark 8:14-21 Jesus' Followers Misunderstand His Words , Mark 8:22-26 Jesus Heals a Blind Man in Bethsaida , Mark 8:27-30 Peter Knows Who Jesus Is , Mark 8:31-38 Jesus Tells His Followers that Son of Man Must Die

9.title: Mark 9
9.description: Mark 9:1, Mark 9:2-13 Jesus with Moses and Elijah, Mark 9:14-29 Jesus Cast out an Evil Spirit from a Boy , Mark 9:30-32 Jesus Talks About His Death to His Followers , Mark 9:33-37 Who is the Greatest?, Mark 9:38-41 Whoever is not Against Jesus is With Him , Mark 9:42-50 Jesus Warns About Causes of Sin

10.title: Mark 10
10.description: Mark 10:1-12 Jesus Teaches About Divorce , Mark 10:13-16 Jesus Blesses Children , Mark 10:17-32 A Rich Man Refuses to Follow Jesus, Mark 10:33-34 Jesus Talks Again About His Death to His Followers, Mark 10:35-45 James and John Ask for a Help, Mark 10:46-52 Jesus Heals a Blind Man

11.title: Mark 11
11.description: Mark 11:1-11 Jesus Enters Jerusalem Like a King, Mark 11:12-19 Jesus Curses a Fruitless Fig Tree, Mark 11:20-26 The Parable of Fig Tree and Faith, Prayer and Forgiveness, Mark 11:27-33 The Leading Priests, the Teachers of the Law and the Older Leaders Question Jesus' Authority

12.title: Mark 12
12.description: Mark 12:1-12 Jesus Tells a Story about a Vineyard, Mark 12:13-17 Jesus Replies to Trick Question of Pharisees and Herodians, Mark 12:18-27 Some Sadducees Try to Trick Jesus, Mark 12:28-34 Which Command is the Most Important?, Mark 12:35-37 Messiah is not David's Son, Mark 12:38-40 Jesus Criticizes the Deeds of the Teachers of the Law, Mark 12:41-44 A Poor Widow's Offering to God

13.title: Mark 13
13.description: Mark 13:1-23 Jesus Informs His Followers About the Future, Mark 13:24-37 Jesus Comes Again After These Things

14.title: Mark 14
14.description: Mark 14:1-2 Leading Priests and Teachers of the Law Plan to Kill Jesus, Mark 14:3-9 A Woman Honours Jesus, Mark 14:10-11 Leading Priests Offer Money to Judas to Hand Over Jesus, Mark 14:12-21 The Passover Meal, Mark 14:22-26 The Lord's Supper, Mark 14:27-31 Jesus Says to His Followers You will Leaves Me, Mark 14:32-42 Jesus Prays Alone, Mark 14:43-52 Jesus Is Arrested, Mark 14:53-65 The High Priest Questions Jesus, Mark 14:66-72 Peter Denies Jesus Thrice

15.title: Mark 15
15.description: Mark 15:1-5 Governor Pilate Questions Jesus, Mark 15:6-20 Pilate Tries to Free Jesus, Mark 15:21-32 Jesus Is Nailed to a Cross, Mark 15:33-41 Jesus Dies, Mark 15:42-47 Jesus is Buried in the Tomb

16.title: Mark 16
16.description: Mark 16:1-8 Jesus Has Risen From Death, Mark 16:9-13 Some Followers See Jesus, Mark 16:14-18 Jesus Talks to His Followers, Mark 16:19-20 Jesus Goes Back to Heaven

1.title: Titus 1
1.description: Titus 1:1-16 Paul explains Titus's Responsibility in Crete Island

2.title: Titus 2
2.description: Titus 2:1-15 Titus Must Teach the Word of God Truly to the Believer

3.title: Titus 3
3.description: Titus 3:1-15 How a Believer's Life Must Show Good Example to the People?
